meanings.sent1: She was fashing about her upcoming test.
meanings.sent2: I can't stop fashing about what might happen.
meanings.sent3: He was fashing so much, he forgot his own name!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was fashing with thoughts like a stormy sea.
meanings.sent5: The image of failure kept fashing in her mind like a flickering light.

meanings.definition: A state of agitation or distress.
meanings.sent1: The constant fashing in her mind was exhausting.
meanings.sent2: His fashing was visible in the way he paced back and forth.
meanings.sent3: The fashing in the room was palpable, making everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent4: The fashing of the crowd resembled a beehive buzzing with activity.
meanings.sent5: The fashing of emotions overwhelmed her like a tidal wave.

meanings.sent1: Stop fashing me with your constant questions.
meanings.sent2: The loud music from next door was really fashing me.
meanings.sent3: His little brother loved to fash him when he was trying to study.
meanings.sent4: The persistent rain continued to fash the farmers trying to harvest.
meanings.sent5: The buzzing mosquito fashed her all night, keeping her awake.

meanings.definition: A state of excitement or commotion.
meanings.sent1: The fashing in the stadium was electrifying.
meanings.sent2: The fashing of the city during the festival was contagious.
meanings.sent3: The children's laughter added to the fashing of the birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The fashing of colors at the parade was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The fashing of fireworks lit up the night sky with joy.
